benchmark_details.name: Food-500 Cap (A Fine-Grained Food Caption Benchmark for Evaluating Vision-Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: Food-500 Cap is a newly proposed benchmark dataset consisting of 24,700 food images with fine-grained captions detailing food attributes and geographic origins. It aims to evaluate vision-language models in the food domain, addressing their performance and biases across different culinary cultures.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the vision-language model's performance in the food domain and identify limitations and biases in culinary culture.

data.source: ISIA Food-500 dataset, annotated by a data annotation company, with descriptions of fine-grained visual features and geographic origins.
data.annotation: Human-annotated fine-grained descriptions including color, shape, and geographic origin.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of nine vision-language models on set tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Models underperformed in food-related tasks compared to general benchmarks, revealing significant biases.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes annotations based on geographic regions, allowing for analysis of model performance across different culinary cultures.
